tweets.text:
The special edition of the Current Magazine is out now - celebrating the @envagency reaching its target of better protecting 300,000 homes from the risk of flooding.

The magazine features a story on the Hull Humber frontages. 

Read the story here: https://t.co/uStp1DnFEa
#FCERM https://t.co/BtUsNeI5Iq

@KarenShackleto5 2)
Current situation:-
Lots of small sewage systems are not compliant with current legislation, many are discharging disgusting quantities of pollutants and the @EnvAgency spends more time denying problems exist than actually dealing with them

tbc

@KarenShackleto5 1) 
One thing I have learnt in relation to small sewage system discharges is:-
legislation was introduced but it didn't work as few registered their systems.
2015 Legislation was revised and relaxed so that it wasn't cumbersome
2020 some new legislation was introduced
tbc

After being convicted&jailed as a result of criminal activity in the waste industry you‚Äôd think a person would be banned from positions of responsibility in that industry again @EnvAgency You need to justify why you allowed a convicted criminal to operate a dangerous landfill https://t.co/pwErtF70TH

@EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @MattHancock we‚Äôre dealing with a situation none of us have put ourselves into, we have our own problems too. It makes dealing with anything harder we‚Äôre week and warn down mentally #StopTheStink #MentalHealthAwareness @StinkStopthe we can‚Äôt take much more

tweets.text: @HelenVi00175623 @SianieRoo @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @Feargal_Sharkey @PHE_uk @DefraGovUK @StinkStopthe @ChrisGPackham Oh don't get me started on that topic! Right now though, I genuinely think the @RedIndustries2 Walleys Quarry disaster is the most urgent in the country. And I  imagine it's a wildlife as well as a human one.

urls.title: Buy a rod fishing licence
urls.description: How and where to buy or upgrade a rod fishing licence for salmon, trout, freshwater fish, smelt and eels in England and Wales.

tweets.text:
Our fisheries enforcement officers are patrolling by the River Trent in #Staffordshire. 

As it is currently coarse fishing close season, you can check where to fish https://t.co/thHQZVRnZB and buy a licence https://t.co/NCS6baL2rA https://t.co/pZpzI6Iqbg

tweets.text: Great to be out and about on Operation Clampdown 9 detecting out of season offences and popping into local angling shops to see some great advice on trout fishing and local fishing folk producing licences to water bailiffs before they go out fishing.  @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/1HRivvAuOF

tweets.text: @BenM_Anderson @HelenVi00175623 @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @Feargal_Sharkey @PHE_uk @DefraGovUK @StinkStopthe Totally unaware of that, and it‚Äôs such a beautiful place as well. Must admit I‚Äôve started calling it the Anti-EA!

@BenM_Anderson @HelenVi00175623 @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @Feargal_Sharkey @PHE_uk @DefraGovUK @StinkStopthe @ChrisGPackham @RedIndustries2 Most definitely affecting wildlife because even pets are getting symptoms of H2S exposure.I‚Äôm glad someone recognises how significant this is.Our best hope seems to be shaming the authorities/govt into stumping the money up to close it/cap it/restore it @Cap_it_off #stopthestink

The @EnvAgency has launched the new flooding action plan, get the details here üèûÔ∏è 
https://t.co/4UDDKh8Ngu

I just had a call from Tom @StoptheStink He is going to be speaking to Dermot & Dave from @TodayFM about the situation at Walleys Quarry in NUL shortly. He's going to mention the situation at Mullaghglass also üëè

#stopthestink #mullaghglass #walleysquarry

üóûÔ∏èThe #BostonBarrier made the #CurrentMagazine17 front page!

The latest issue is live & you might spot a familiar project on the front cover (& pages 13 & 16!). Click below to read about @EnvAgency's successes over the last 6 years & what's planned next.

https://t.co/6gJya0oYPk
@RiverCalder @CanalRiverTrust @Calderdale @EnvAgencyYNE @YorkshireWater Yuck indeed! It‚Äôs on Key Sike Lane, off Halifax Road, Todmorden.
@SianieRoo @MattHancock @PHE_EoEngland @capitoff @defra you do have the power to end this for us , Revoke their permit Now please .

tweets.text: Let's be nice and say a Combined Sewage Overflow has a flow rate of 1 litres a minute 3,100,000 hours equals 186 million minutes divide that by 1000 as 1 Litre of (water) equals 1 kilo in weight gives us a grand total of 186,000 tons of Sewage Dumped into our Rivers in 2020 https://t.co/cphlHz8k8J
@SianieRoo @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off Oh yes - I think it is a reason, but it shouldn't be an excuse.

@HelenVi00175623 @SianieRoo @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @Feargal_Sharkey @PHE_uk @DefraGovUK @StinkStopthe Yep. There's also been a spate of instances of wanton destruction of wildlife and habitat, followed by EA intervention, followed by some shrugging of shoulders. The Carbis Bay Hotel cutting down a swath of coastal woodland to host a G7 summit on climate change, for example.

@BenM_Anderson @SianieRoo @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @Feargal_Sharkey @PHE_uk @DefraGovUK @StinkStopthe @ChrisGPackham @RedIndustries2 Thank you. It's having a massive impact on domestic animals and wildlife as well as the ecosystem in general. We have badger sets on the periphery of the landfill & they're affected during breading season. I believe bee's & other pollinators are also under attack.
@StinkStopthe

@DeniseO97662017 @StinkStopthe @SianieRoo @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @BorisJohnson @MattHancock I don't understand this..I thought the local MP had a meeting with George Eustace, secretary of state for the environment..who is responsible for the ea.... surely after he heard about this problem funding could be given to sort this out?

urls.title: The RNLI reflects on the tragic plight of the minke whale
urls.description: After yesterday's tragic ending to the story of the minke whale trapped in the Thames, the RNLI reflect on the whale's story.

tweets.text:
"Every so often a story such as this is driven by the emotions as much as the facts." Thank you to all the rescue teams who worked tirelessly to help the whale and to @rnli_teddington for this reflective piece. @RNLI @BDMLR @EnvAgency @metpoliceuk
https://t.co/9Du3EeJEUr
